newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil reverses trend, ends up on covering.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil reverses trend, ends up on covering.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICALS
Sept (3rd pos) 1,162 rgt/tonne July (south) 1,200
Open/Hi/Low 1,148/1,164/1,142 Prev close 1,195
Prev settlement 1,157 * sellers prices

PALM OIL FUTURES - The market reversed an early downtrend to close higher on refiners' covering and cash market buying. Caleb Brett's June export estimates had no impact on prices, which fell sharply earlier due to weak soyoil on bearish USDA report. Sept rebounded and the next resistance is at 1,175.
PALM OIL PHYSICALS - Also recovered on refiners' support and and interest was seen among CPOs and products.
The morning fall was overdone and the afternoon rise was a technical correction to recent losses, traders said.
At the close, the September futures recovered five ringgit to 1,162 ringgit ($460.38) a kg after falling to a low of 1,142 ringgit earlier.
Other contracts also posted gains across the the futures sector, they said.
Traders said the early trading was hit by weak in Chicago soyoil futures which fell to a four-year low on news the USDA pegged 1997 soybean acreage at the highest level in 15 years.
"The charts are pointing downward and more technical selling is likely if the September futures breaches the next support at 1,140 ringgit," the trader added
"The market has discounted the export estimate for June from Caleb," another trader said. Cargo surveyor Caleb Brett put June palm oil exports at 634,753 tonnes vs 641,950 in May.
Trading volume was 3,724 lots.
The physicals saw some renewed interest with refiners seen covering and buying in nearby CPOs and selected products.
Among physicals, July (south) crude palm oil saw offers at 1,200 ringgit against bids at 1,190 after trading from 1,180 to 1,190.
July (central) saw offers at 1,190 versus 1,185 with earlier trades at 1,165 and 1,185.
Aug (south) was offered at 1,200 against bids of 1,192.50 with trades at 1,190 and 1,192.50. Aug (central) was offered at 1,190 against bids of 1,180 after trading at 1,170 and 1,175.
In refined products, July RBD palm oil was offered at $502.50 a tonne FOB Malaysia, Aug/Sept at $500 and Oct/Nov/Dec at $500. Aug/Sept was traded at $495.
July RBD palm olein saw offers at $542.50, Aug/Sept at $537.50, and Oct/Nov/Dec at 537.50.
Aug was traded at $532.50 and $535, and Aug/Sept at $532.50 and $535.
July RBD palm stearin was offered at $385, Aug/Sept at $380 and Aug/Sept palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $290.
